Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

"Autobots..." Perseus said to himself, as he listened in on the radio. "If
only we had Rodimus Prime."

The shuttle and airtankers circled the area. still scanning for enemies.

The entrance of the base was torn apart and the dark interior was open and
apparently ruined, like an old tomb or a cave.  As the group moved inside,
they could tell that the place hadn't been occupied for some time.

At the center of the base, they found the control room, its door still
sealed.  There were blast marks across the door as if someone had attempted
to blow it open, but the standard maximal design made this the most hardened
target in the whole base.

"Control room reached, no contacts.  Preparing to enter." Guardia announced
onto the radio.

On Sat, Nov 21, 2009 at 8:47 PM, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:

> Tucson nodds to Guardia.
>
> "Yes, the Autobots.  My brothers and comrades.  If I could just get a hold
> of any of them, they would be more than willing to help us against Unicron.
>  They bare the same symbol as I do. "
>
> He shows them his Autobot faction symbol on his left arm.
>
> " Also, maybe it wouldn't be such a bad idea if we could get a message to
> the Decepticons.."
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> >
> > "Shuttle to advance team." said Perseus over the radio.  "We're
> > picking up that signal now, We think it's in orbit.  We've circled the
> > area and havent seen anyone.  You're clear to enter the base."
> >
> > "Roger that." replied Guardia, hen looking toward Tuscan.  "Autobots?"
> >
> > "What now?" asked Ravenchief..
> >
> > "Let's clear that base everyone.  Follow me, and dont let your guard
> down."
> >
> > And with that Guardia and the two troopers started to walk toward the
> > ruined entrance of the base.  Ravenchief returned to the air to make
> > one last check of the area.
> >
> > On 10/31/09, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:
> > > Pings now come in all directions and it's not long before Tucson is
> > > completely confused as to which direction to go in.  He knew the best
> thing
> > > to do was to stay put when all else fails.  He appears extremely
> nervous yet
> > > does not fire a single shot, even though he appeared to be a bit itchy
> with
> > > the trigger finger.  But then a familliar energy signature rings a
> bell.  He
> > > narrows his eyes further.
> > >
> > > " The energy signature.. I feel it, I know who and what it is.  And
> here I
> > > thought Unicron was finished.  This means big trouble for everyone.  If
> we
> > > don't stop him now we'll lose every planet in the universe, including
> > > Cybertron!"
> > >
> > > He did not know if any Autobot was still out there.  If there was a
> chance
> > > that one of his comrades could pick up his signal, he was going to
> throw it
> > > out there and hope for the best.  He hoped that his luminated signal
> would
> > > still work,lighting the way for all Autobots to follow.    This was one
> > > battle he knew he couldn't afford to get his new comrades mixed up into
> > > without proper assistance.
> > >
> > > " By the name of Primus, if there are other Autobots out there, please,
> > > answer this call."
> > >
> > > He opens a small window on his left gauntlett, and casts the luminated
> > > Autobot insignia as a beacon, for all Autobots to see, if there were
> any out
> > > there to see it.
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:

> > >> Talon:
> > >>
> > >> talon keeps herself ready for everything, she didnt know why but
> somthing
> > >> may happen soon.

> > >> Unicron:
> > >>
> > >> unicron awakes finally, with the matris of leadership out of action
> and
> > >> the chosen one powerless, He has finally ready to attack "ARAISE MY
> > >> CHILDREN!!!" summoned the massive bot"ARAISE and SERVE YOUR MASTER..."

> that
> > >> wants to have a minion just have to report in teh core that is a
> furisticc

> > >>

> > >> Sent: Friday, October 30, 2009 9:34 PM

> > >>
> > >>
> > >>   OOC: I think anyone with characters in Relay is free to attack the
> > >> maximal group, unless Sandy has something planned. I have a backup
> > >> plan, but would prefer someone else to play the opposition as I have
> > >> quite a few characters here. Remember anyone is allowed to play
> > >> generic minions.
> > >>
> > >> Also remember Relay City floats in tne air above the great lakes
> > >> region of North America. I imagine this base being on the ground a
> > >> short distance away from the city, but perhaps within sight. That's
> > >> it.
> > >>
> > >> I'll post for my characters separately.
> > >>
> > >> On 10/26/09, Sandy <magicquartz@> wrote:
> > >> > Tucson had a feeling that it was best to stay in robot mode. If
> > >> > something
> > >> > were to jump out at them, he'd be a bit vunlerable in vehicle form.
> To
> > >> > keep
> > >> > in touch with what ever was out there, he sends a few more wide
> range
> > >> > sonar
> > >> > signals to see if any of them bounced off any objects or anyone who
> > >> > could be
> > >> > within the area. The ping resonating from the sonar waves, comes
> back
> > >> > loud
> > >> > and clear. It was straight ahead. He keeps on his course, all
> headlights
> > >> > off, to reduce the chance of being discovered.
> > >> >
> > >> > "Just like old times. Except now, it's not the Decepticons we need
> to be
> > >> > concerned with. I threw out a few more sonar waves, and the signal I
> got
> > >> > back was very strong. Sounded as if the signal bounced off of a
> metallic
> > >> > object, maybe a structure, building, large aircraft, or vehicle for
> that
> > >> > matter. But the signal is unfamilliar to me. It sounded a tad
> different
> > >> > when it came back."
> > >> >
> > >> > Out of curiosity, he puts a hand out in front of him, and extends
> his
> > >> > palm
> > >> > to feel the currents of air going through his fingers. It was his
> way of
> > >> > reading residual energy which may have been released along with the
> > >> > signal.
> > >> > Even though it wasn't visible, he senses a vibration in his hand.
> The
> > >> > loss
> > >> > of sight also enabled him to touch things with more sensitivity than
> > >> > normal.
> > >> >
> > >> >
> > >> > " I'm picking up an unknown energy signature through residual
> feedback.
> > >> > Ravenchief, Guardia, Talon, I don't have good feelings about this. I
> > >> > think
> > >> > it's best if you back me up, and let me go in first. I can take a
> good
> > >> > beating if I have to. All right, Lord Perseus is right, caution is a
> > >> > must."
> > >> >
> > >> > He bravely takes slow and silent steps ahead of his comrades, and
> > >> > continues
> > >> > walking forward. He loads the cross bow, and then keeps it at the
> ready.
> > >> > As an Autobot, he took an oath to protect the innocent. Even if it
> meant
> > >> > risking his own spark to do so. He wasn't afraid to be obliterated
> if it
> > >> > happened so be it. He felt better as to his decision to go in first,
> to
> > >> > ensure the saftey of his Maximal comrades. After all, it was what
> > >> > Autobots
> > >> > did for centuries, and he was no different than any of them.
> > >> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@> wrote:

> > >> >>

> run
> > >> >> into something. We're going to investigate. Could we get a scanner
> > >> >> sweep
> > >> >> from above?"
> > >> >>

> > >> >> someone from the shuttle, then Lord Perseus spoke. "If this is a

> you
> > >> >> up."

> > >> >> the
> > >> >> team began to move.

> > >> >> grumbled.

> one
> > >> >> direction , one source. He turns himself toward it and points to

> > >> >>
> > >> >> " That way. It's coming from THAT direction. The closser I go to
> it,
> > >> >> the stronger it becomes."
> > >> >>

> > >> >> was bouncing off of.

> > >> >> > > can follow. He sends out several more sonar signals, hoping

> > >> >> > > one of them would bounce back with answers.

> > >> >> did not
